articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives New Year Cards from Chinese Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives New Year Cards from Chinese Leaders
 Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received the New Year cards from Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Communist Party of China and president of the People's Republic of China, and Wen Jiabao, premier of State Council of the PRC, on the New Year Juche 100 (2011). 
					 Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and the minister councilor of the Chinese embassy respectively handed over the New Year cards to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and an official concerned.

articles.title: Reception in Moscow Marks DPRK Anniversaries
articles.content:
Reception in Moscow Marks DPRK Anniversaries
Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Moscow gave a reception on Dec. 23 to observe the 19th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army and the 93rd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 Present there on invitation were personages of the government, political parties and organizations of Russia.
					
					 They included Aleksandr Torshyn, first vice-chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, a roving ambassador of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and personages of the Liberal Democratic Party, the Party for Peace and Unity, the Communist Party of Soviet Union, All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Defense, the Ministry of Economy and Development, the Academy of Sciences, the Railway Company, the  Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, the Russian Federation of International Charity Organizations "World of Goodwill" and groups for the study of the Juche idea.
					
					 Ambassador Kim Yong Jae and staff members of the DPRK embassy were on hand.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the full-length painting of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. And they looked round photos under the titles "Leader Kim Jong Il and Science and Technology of the DPRK" and "The Whole Life Dedicated to the People". 
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: New Year Greetings from Diplomatic Corps
articles.content:
New Year Greetings from Diplomatic Corps
 Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of the New Year.
					 Chhorn Hay, Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK, on behalf of the corps handed them to Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on Wednesday.

articles.title: New Year Greetings from Chinese Family
articles.content:
New Year Greetings from Chinese Family
 Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the family of Zhang Weihua, a Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, Wednesday on the occasion of the New Year.

articles.title: New Year Greetings from Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
New Year Greetings from Overseas Koreans
 Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- The family of Jong Il Sim, a Korean resident in Russia, sent a floral basket to the statue of President Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the New Year.
					 It was laid before the statue on Wednesday.

articles.title: Book on Medicinal Herbs Published
articles.content:
Book on Medicinal Herbs Published
 Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- The book "Korean Medicinal Herbs" (two volumes) has been brought out by the Medical Science Publishing House of the DPRK.
					 The book is based on findings concerning ingredients, pharmacological actions and usage of some 1 500 medical plants.
					
					 It, made up of parts like origins, plants, pharmaceuticals, ingredients, pharmacological actions and usage, gives profound explanations of medical plants as well as reference materials.
					
					 It is conducive to manufacturing good medicines with medicinal herbs abundant in Korea and developing Koryo medicine.

articles.title: New Mineral Springs Discovered
articles.content:
New Mineral Springs Discovered
 Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- New mineral springs have been discovered in the DPRK to be used for medical treatment.
					 The Mineral Spring Prospecting Corps under the Ministry of Public Health made a survey of more than ten natural springs in Myongchon area this year to confirm that they are useful for the prevention and treatment of diseases.
					
					 The sulfur springs in Komun, Taho and Tokpho are 40-80 degrees C.
					
					 Those in Masan, Posu Valley and Yondok are 14-16 degrees C.
					
					 Korea boasts of several hundred mineral springs.
					
					 Most of them are radon, sulfur, iron and chlorine springs efficacious for digestive trouble, hypertension, neuralgia, chronic hepatitis and other diseases.
					
					 The temperature of the water is 20-80 degrees C, the maximum being 100 degrees C.
					
					 Modern sanatoria were built in Kyongsong, Kangso, Sambang and other famous spas for climatic, physical and mud bath therapies.
					
					 Meanwhile, mineral water in Kangso, Sambang, Okhodong and Mt. Myohyang contains sodium calcium bicarbonate, sulfuric aluminum and free carbon.

articles.title: Cutting Faces Made Large at Ryongyang Mine
articles.content:
Cutting Faces Made Large at Ryongyang Mine
 Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- The Ryongyang Mine, the DPRK's giant magnesite producer, has made its cutting sites large-sized. 
					 This year the Kumsan and Youth pits have turned their cutting sites into large-sized stopes to raise the production 50 percent higher than the previous year.
					
					 A ring road was built to connect large cutting faces with each other and the ore-unloading place was reconstructed at the Kumsan Pit.
					
					 Its miners have employed a caving method to boost the output.
					
					 The project of making cutting faces Nos. 2 and 3 of the June 5 Pit is making headway in the mine.
					
					 With the cutting faces made large-sized and cutting methods suitable for them introduced, it has been possible for the mine to massively mine and dress ores.

articles.title: US Has No Face to Take Issue with DPRK's Nuclear Activities
articles.content:
US Has No Face to Take Issue with DPRK's Nuclear Activities
Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- "The DPRK's building of an independent light water reactor and its operation of uranium enrichment factory are the natural outcome of the United States' perfidy as it broke its promise to provide light water reactors to it," observed Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed commentary.
					"The building of the independent LWR to round off the structure of nuclear energy industry is making brisk headway in the DPRK and a modern uranium enrichment factory with thousands of centrifuges is operating on a normal footing to feed fuel to the LWR," the commentary noted, and continued:
					
					"This being a hard reality, the U.S. and other forces, prompted by their perverted intentions, are contemplating stronger pressure and sanctions against the DPRK over its issue of LWR though it is meant for producing electricity".
					
					"The DPRK chose to build an independent LWR with its own resources and its own technology to round off the structure of the Juche-oriented nuclear energy industry. This was its natural option in the light of the legitimate right to nuclear activities for peaceful purposes, the worldwide trend of developing nuclear energy and the country's daily increasing demand for electricity".
					
					"The U.S. has no face to take issue with the DPRK's nuclear activities for peaceful purposes."
					
					"The DPRK-U.S. Agreed Framework signed in 1994 calls on the U.S. to build two LWRs and provide them to the DPRK on a turn-key basis by 2003."
					
					"Had the U.S. kept the above-said promise, the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula would have not remained so complicated as now."
					
					"It is universally recognized right of the countries both inside and outside the NPT to exercise the above-said right to use nuclear energy for peaceful purposes. It is entirely just for the DPRK to exercise this legitimate right."

articles.title: KCNA Assails Japanâ€™s Cunning Scenario for Overseas Aggression
articles.content:
KCNA Assails Japan's Cunning Scenario for Overseas Aggression
Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- Some days ago Japan conducted a drill for the inspection of cargo of airliners bound for the DPRK.
					The drill was allegedly conducted according to the so-called "'Cargo Inspection Law' which calls for inspecting ships and planes suspected of carrying nuclear and missile related cargo bound for north Korea."
					
					This brings to light the ulterior intention of the Japanese reactionaries to fish in troubled waters by taking advantage of the escalating tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					The recent drill staged by Japan in the wake of its enforcement of the above-said law since July suggests that it was part of Japan's moves to convert itself into a military power, an indication of a step forward in carrying out its overseas military operation. Its target is the DPRK.
					
					As part of its preparations for overseas aggression Japan has steadily boosted the military operation capability of the "Self-Defense Forces." It unusually increased the frequency of urgent takeoff the Air "Self-Defense Force" and started developing supersonic air-to-ship missiles meant for F-2s under the pretext of coping with unidentified planes likely to intrude into its territorial air although there was not a single foreign plane which violated its territorial air in recent years.
					
					The new "guidelines of the defense program" published in Japan recently calls for deploying mobile strike forces mainly formed with Naval and Air "Self-Defense Forces" in its southwestern region close to the Korean Peninsula and China.
					
					The anti-DPRK racket and moves for turning Japan into a military giant stepped up by it under the pretext of holding in check the DPRK's "transport of nuclear and missile related cargo" betray a grave militarist scenario for paving the way for reinvasion, availing itself of the tension on the peninsula.
					
					Japan is, however, seriously miscalculating.
					
					Its military action against the DPRK is bound to lead to its self-destruction.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Revolutionary Life of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Revolutionary Life of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- The long history of the Korean revolution, which started and advanced with arms, tells about the great exploits and immortal revolutionary career of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk, who remained true to President Kim Il Sung's cause of Songun with arms all her life.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk embarked on the road of the revolution in her teens and devoted her all to the sacred cause of Songun for the independence of the country and freedom and liberation of the people until the last moments of her life, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 It was her firm belief that the goal and value of the Korean revolutionaries' life is to become a fortress to safeguard Kim Il Sung politico-ideologically and at the risk of their lives.
					
					 His safety means the security of the country and the primary task of the armed revolutionaries is to reliably defend his authority and prestige. This was the revolutionary faith of Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 True to her pledge made when taking arms of the revolution, she carried her arms in her hand till the last moments of her life and glorified her life as a revolutionary. Her feats for building the Juche-oriented revolutionary armed forces can be found in that she took pains to accomplish Kim Il Sung's cause of army building including building of air, navy and tank forces with Korean characteristics.
					
					 Her noble spirit can be felt in the stamina of the invincible revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu and the history of the defence industry of the DPRK which is able to produce any up-to-date weapons at its will.
					
					 As the closest comrade-in-arms of the President, Kim Jong Suk stood in the van of faithfully upholding his Songun idea, wearing military clothing of the revolution all her life. Her immortal life serves as the most valuable treasure for the victorious advance of the Korean revolution and as a noble paragon for glorifying the life of revolutionaries.

articles.title: Seminars Held to Mark DPRK Anniversaries
articles.content:
Seminars Held to Mark DPRK Anniversaries
Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- Seminars took place in Uganda, Russia and France between Dec. 20 and 22. They are to mark the 19th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army and the 93rd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 Kim Jong Il is deeply respected not only by the Korean people but by the world progressives as he turned the DPRK into an invincible power with his Songun revolutionary leadership, said the chairman of the Kampala City Committee of the Uganda National Resistance Movement. 
					
					 The DPRK will demonstrate its might as an invincible power under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il in the future, too, he added.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk devoted herself to protecting the safety of President Kim Il Sung and carrying out his orders, said the chief of the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Idea. She is always remembered by the progressive people, the chief added.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at a seminar in France.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia 
 Pyongyang, December 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Respecting the Forerunners of the Revolution Is a Noble Moral Obligation of Revolutionaries" was brought out in booklet by Khabarovskaya Krayevaya Tipografia Publishing House of Russia on Dec. 21. 
					 The work, published on Dec. 25, Juche 84 (1995), gives the idea that to respect the forerunners is the demand of the revolution. It also clarifies the principled matters in establishing the moral traits of respecting the revolutionary predecessors and developing sound relations between the people based on morality and loyalty.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores y carta del Cuerpo Diplomatico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores y carta del Cuerpo Diplomatico
Pyongyang, 29 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio un cesto de flores y carta de felicitacion que le dedicara el Cuerpo Diplomatico acreditado en Corea con motivo del Ano Nuevo.
					En representacion del cuerpo, el embajador camboyano, Chhorn Hay, los entrego el dia 29 al canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de la familia de Zhang Weihua
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de la familia de Zhang Weihua
						
Pyongyang, 29 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio un cesto de flores que con motivo del Nuevo Ano, le enviara el dia 29 la familia del martir revolucionario antijapones chino Zhang Weihua.

articles.title: Familia de Jong Il Sim envia cesto de flores
articles.content:
Familia de Jong Il Sim envia cesto de flores
Pyongyang, 29 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Fue depositado el dia 29 ante la estatua de bronce del Presidente Kim Il Sung un cesto de flores enviado por la familia de la coreana residente en Rusia, Jong  Il Sim, con motivo del Ano Nuevo.

articles.title: ATCC comenta intencion de Japon de agredir a ultramar
articles.content:
ATCC comenta intencion de Japon de agredir a ultramar
Pyongyang, 29 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Hace poco, Japon realizo el ejercicio de control de cargas de los aviones con rumbo a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, en virtud de la "'ley de control de cargas' que permite registrar los barcos y aviones sospechosos de transportar a la RPDC los materiales relacionados con armas nucleares y misiles".
					Este entrenamiento demuestra la astuta intencion de los reaccionarios japoneses de sacar provechos de la agravacion de la situacion en la Peninsula Coreana. Igualmente, forma parte de los preparativos para convertir a su pais en una potencia militar, especificamente, es un paso para cumplir las operaciones militares en ultramar. El blanco directo de ellas seria evidentemente la RPDC.
					
					Entro en vigor en julio ultimo la mencionada ley extraterritorial que autoriza registrar las embarcaciones y aviones extranjeros fuera del territorio japones.
					
					A pesar de que en los ultimos anos, ni un solo avion extranjero invadio el espacio aereo de Japon, este pais aumento mas que nunca el numero de despegue emergente de las "Fuerzas Aereas de Autodefensa", bajo el pretexto de "hacer frente a los aviones de nacionalidad desconocida que puedan infiltrarse en el espacio aereo jurisdiccional". Y comenzo el desarrollo del misil supersonico aire-mar a ser instalado en el caza "F-2" y realizo otros trabajos para mejorar constantemente la capacidad operacional de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa".
					
					En el "programa de defensa" recien publicado tambien esta estipulado que se emplazarian concentradamente en la zona suroeste de Japon, cerca de la Peninsula Coreana y China, las tropas de ataque movil cuyo grueso es "Fuerzas Navales y Aereas de Autodefensa".
					
					Las maniobras de conversion en la potencia militar y la campana anti-RPDC, que lanza nuevamente Japon bajo el pretexto de hacer frente al "transporte de materiales de armas nucleares y misiles" por ella, parte de su aventurera intencion militarista de retomar el camino de agresion aprovechando la tensa situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Los muy equivocados reaccionarios japoneses deben saber que sus acciones militares contra la RPDC traeran su propio arruinamiento.

articles.title: EE.UU. no debe cuestionar las actividades nucleares de Corea
articles.content:
EE.UU. no debe cuestionar las actividades nucleares de Corea
Pyongyang, 29 de diciembre (ATCC) -- La construccion independiente del reactor de agua ligera y el funcionamiento de la fabrica de uranio enriquecido en Corea se deben a Estados Unidos que no cumplio su promesa de ofrecer a la primera el reactor del mismo tipo. 
					Senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual divulgado este miercoles y continua:
					
					Para abastecer el combustible al reactor de agua ligera en plena construccion, funciona normalmente en la RPDC la fabrica de uranio enriquecido que tiene miles de centrifugadoras.
					
					EE.UU. y algunas fuerzas de mal genio pretenden presionar y sancionar a la RPDC cuestionando esas actividades nucleares con fines pacificos para la produccion electrica.
					
					La construccion independiente del reactor de agua ligera con recursos y tecnicas nacionales forma parte de los proyectos para completar la estructura de la autoctona industria de energia nuclear.
					
					Esto significa el ejercicio del legitimo derecho a las actividades nucleares pacificas y conviene a la corriente internacional de desarrollo y uso de energia nuclear. Ademas, resulta una prioridad para cubrir la creciente demanda sobre la electricidad en la RPDC.
					
					EE.UU. no tiene la cara para cuestionar las actividades nucleares con fines pacificas de ella.
					
					Segun el Acuerdo Basico RPDC-EE.UU., publicado en el ano 1994, este imperio debe construir en la RPDC dos reactores de agua ligera y entregarselos con las llaves de operacion.
					
					Si EE.UU. hubiera cumplido su compromiso, el problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana no habria sido tan complicado como ahora. 
					
					El uso de energia nuclear con fines pacificos es el derecho reconocido internacionalmente que tienen por igual los paises dentro y fuera del Tratado de No Proliferacion. 
					
					Es muy justo que la RPDC ejerza ese derecho.
